Home → Events and activities → Lowestoft Library Children’s Festival

Lowestoft Library Children’s Festival

  • Lowestoft Library

  • Sat 22 Oct, 2016
  • 1000 – 1600

Free event split into morning and afternoon sessions with activities to suit older and younger children.

Morning Session: 1000-1200

Story Time: Tea with Bea, by Gracie Wright.

Gracie Wright has written books to raise money for Addenbrooke’s Intensive Care Unit, 19 years after it saved her life. She’ll be reading her first, Tea With Bea, a beautiful story for young children.

Followed by a tea-themed craft workshop session.

Rhymes and stories with Terry Tarbox

Terry is an accomplished local children’s poet and author of the popular The Willigrews stories for older children. He’ll be reading some of his rhymes and stories.

Afternoon session: 1330-1600

Story time: Hercules the Tap-Dancing Octopus, by Alan Popham

The author’s daughter will read Hercules the Tap Dancing Octopus, accompanied by live drawing by cartoonist Marko.

Followed by an octopus-themed craft session.

Q&A with Francesca Armour-Chelu

Francesca Armour-Chelu has written two acclaimed books for older children, Fenn Halfin and the Fearzero, Lemon Ink Over Flame and a short story, The Starving Ghost. She will be reading from her books.

The afternoon will end with children’s poetry with June Nice, a local children’s poet, and Terry Tarbox.
